verses.kjv: Now in the twenty and fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, and with sackclothes, and earth upon them.
verses.ct: On the 24th day of that month, the people of Israel gathered together, fasting and wearing rough cloth, with dirt on their heads.

verses.kjv: And the seed of Israel separated themselves from all strangers, and stood and confessed their sins, and the iniquities of their fathers.
verses.ct: Those of Israelite descent separated themselves from all foreigners. They stood and openly confessed their sins and the wrongdoing of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And they stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law of the LORD their God one fourth part of the day; and another fourth part they confessed, and worshipped the LORD their God.
verses.ct: They stood where they were and listened to a reading from the book of the law of the LORD their God for a quarter of the day. Then for another quarter of the day, they confessed their sins and worshiped the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: Then stood up upon the stairs, of the Levites, Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried with a loud voice unto the LORD their God.
verses.ct: Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani stood on the Levites' platform and called out loudly to the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: Then the Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodijah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said, Stand up and bless the LORD your God for ever and ever: and blessed be thy glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.
verses.ct: Then the Levites — Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodijah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah — said, "Rise and praise the LORD your God, who exists forever and ever! May your glorious name be praised — it is far above all praise and blessing."

verses.kjv: Thou, even thou, art LORD alone; thou hast made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth, and all things that are therein, the seas, and all that is therein, and thou preservest them all; and the host of heaven worshippeth thee.
verses.ct: "You alone are the LORD. You made heaven, the highest heavens with all their armies of stars, the earth and everything on it, the seas and everything in them. You keep all of it alive, and the armies of heaven worship you."

verses.kjv: Thou art the LORD the God, who didst choose Abram, and broughtest him forth out of Ur of the Chaldees, and gavest him the name of Abraham;
verses.ct: "You are the LORD God, who chose Abram and brought him out of Ur of the Chaldees and gave him the name Abraham."

verses.kjv: And foundest his heart faithful before thee, and madest a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Jebusites, and the Girgashites, to give it, I say, to his seed, and hast performed thy words; for thou art righteous:
verses.ct: "You found his heart to be faithful in your presence, and you made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Jebusites, and Girgashites — to give it to his descendants. And you kept your promise, because you are righteous."

verses.kjv: And didst see the affliction of our fathers in Egypt, and heardest their cry by the Red sea;
verses.ct: "You saw the suffering of our ancestors in Egypt and heard their cry at the Red Sea."

verses.kjv: And shewedst signs and wonders upon Pharaoh, and on all his servants, and on all the people of his land: for thou knewest that they dealt proudly against them. So didst thou get thee a name, as it is this day.
verses.ct: "You performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, all his officials, and all the people of his land, because you knew how arrogantly they treated our ancestors. You made a name for yourself that endures to this day."

verses.kjv: And thou didst divide the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and their persecutors thou threwest into the deeps, as a stone into the mighty waters.
verses.ct: "You split the sea in front of them so they walked through on dry ground. You hurled their pursuers into the depths like a stone thrown into powerful waters."

verses.kjv: Moreover thou leddest them in the day by a cloudy pillar; and in the night by a pillar of fire, to give them light in the way wherein they should go.
verses.ct: "You guided them during the day with a pillar of cloud and at night with a pillar of fire, giving them light on the path they needed to travel."

verses.kjv: Thou camest down also upon mount Sinai, and spakest with them from heaven, and gavest them right judgments, and true laws, good statutes and commandments:
verses.ct: "You came down on Mount Sinai and spoke to them from heaven. You gave them fair regulations, reliable laws, and good instructions and commands."

verses.kjv: And madest known unto them thy holy sabbath, and commandedst them precepts, statutes, and laws, by the hand of Moses thy servant:
verses.ct: "You revealed your holy Sabbath to them and gave them rules, instructions, and laws through your servant Moses."

verses.kjv: And gavest them bread from heaven for their hunger, and broughtest forth water for them out of the rock for their thirst, and promisedst them that they should go in to possess the land which thou hadst sworn to give them.
verses.ct: "You gave them bread from heaven when they were hungry and brought water out of a rock when they were thirsty. You told them to go and take possession of the land you had sworn to give them."

verses.kjv: But they and our fathers dealt proudly, and hardened their necks, and hearkened not to thy commandments,
verses.ct: "But they — our ancestors — acted arrogantly. They became stubborn and refused to listen to your commands."

verses.kjv: And refused to obey, neither were mindful of thy wonders that thou didst among them; but hardened their necks, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage: but thou art a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and forsookest them not.
verses.ct: "They refused to obey and forgot the wonders you had done among them. They became stubborn and, in their rebellion, chose a leader to take them back to slavery. But you are a God who is ready to forgive, gracious and merciful, slow to get angry, and rich in kindness. You did not abandon them."

verses.kjv: Yea, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, This is thy God that brought thee up out of Egypt, and had wrought great provocations;
verses.ct: "Even when they made a metal calf and said, 'This is your god who brought you out of Egypt,' and committed terrible offenses,"

verses.kjv: Yet thou in thy manifold mercies forsookest them not in the wilderness: the pillar of the cloud departed not from them by day, to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night, to shew them light, and the way wherein they should go.
verses.ct: "you, in your abundant mercy, still did not abandon them in the wilderness. The pillar of cloud did not leave them during the day but guided them on their way, and the pillar of fire stayed with them at night, lighting the path they should follow."

verses.kjv: Thou gavest also thy good spirit to instruct them, and withheldest not thy manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for their thirst.
verses.ct: "You gave your good Spirit to teach them. You did not hold back manna from them, and you gave them water when they were thirsty."

verses.kjv: Yea, forty years didst thou sustain them in the wilderness, so that they lacked nothing; their clothes waxed not old, and their feet swelled not.
verses.ct: "For 40 years you provided for them in the wilderness so they had everything they needed. Their clothes did not wear out, and their feet did not swell."

verses.kjv: Moreover thou gavest them kingdoms and nations, and didst divide them into corners: so they possessed the land of Sihon, and the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.
verses.ct: "You gave them kingdoms and nations, distributing even the border territories to them. They took over the land of Sihon, the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan."

verses.kjv: Their children also multipliedst thou as the stars of heaven, and broughtest them into the land, concerning which thou hadst promised to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.
verses.ct: "You made their descendants as numerous as the stars in the heavens. You brought them into the land you had promised their ancestors they would enter and possess."

verses.kjv: So the children went in and possessed the land, and thou subduedst before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, and gavest them into their hands, with their kings, and the people of the land, that they might do with them as they would.
verses.ct: "Their descendants went in and took possession of the land. You subdued the Canaanites who lived there, handing over their kings and peoples so the Israelites could deal with them however they wanted."

verses.kjv: And they took strong cities, and a fat land, and possessed houses full of all goods, wells digged, vineyards, and oliveyards, and fruit trees in abundance: so they did eat, and were filled, and became fat, and delighted themselves in thy great goodness.
verses.ct: "They captured fortified cities and fertile land. They took over houses filled with good things, wells already dug, vineyards, olive groves, and fruit trees in great number. They ate until they were satisfied and grew prosperous, enjoying your tremendous goodness."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless they were disobedient, and rebelled against thee, and cast thy law behind their backs, and slew thy prophets which testified against them to turn them to thee, and they wrought great provocations.
verses.ct: "But despite all this, they became disobedient and rebelled against you. They threw your law aside and killed your prophets who warned them and tried to bring them back to you. They committed terrible offenses."

verses.kjv: Therefore thou deliveredst them into the hand of their enemies, who vexed them: and in the time of their trouble, when they cried unto thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and according to thy manifold mercies thou gavest them saviours, who saved them out of the hand of their enemies.
verses.ct: "So you handed them over to their enemies, who oppressed them. But when they were in trouble and cried out to you, you heard them from heaven. In your abundant mercy, you gave them rescuers who delivered them from the power of their enemies."

verses.kjv: But after they had rest, they did evil again before thee: therefore leftest thou them in the hand of their enemies, so that they had the dominion over them: yet when they returned, and cried unto thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and many times didst thou deliver them according to thy mercies;
verses.ct: "But once they had peace again, they went right back to doing evil in your sight. So you left them in the power of their enemies, who ruled over them. Yet when they turned back and cried out to you, you heard them from heaven and rescued them many times because of your mercy."

verses.kjv: And testifiedst against them, that thou mightest bring them again unto thy law: yet they dealt proudly, and hearkened not unto thy commandments, but sinned against thy judgments, (which if a man do, he shall live in them;) and withdrew the shoulder, and hardened their neck, and would not hear.
verses.ct: "You warned them to return to your law, but they acted arrogantly and refused to listen to your commands. They sinned against your regulations — the very ones that give life to anyone who follows them. They turned a stubborn shoulder, stiffened their necks, and would not listen."

verses.kjv: Yet many years didst thou forbear them, and testifiedst against them by thy spirit in thy prophets: yet would they not give ear: therefore gavest thou them into the hand of the people of the lands.
verses.ct: "For many years you were patient with them. You warned them through your Spirit, speaking through your prophets, but they would not pay attention. So you handed them over to the surrounding nations."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless for thy great mercies’ sake thou didst not utterly consume them, nor forsake them; for thou art a gracious and merciful God.
verses.ct: "Yet because of your great mercy, you did not completely destroy them or abandon them, because you are a gracious and merciful God."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, our God, the great, the mighty, and the terrible God, who keepest covenant and mercy, let not all the trouble seem little before thee, that hath come upon us, on our kings, on our princes, and on our priests, and on our prophets, and on our fathers, and on all thy people, since the time of the kings of Assyria unto this day.
verses.ct: "So now, our God — the great, mighty, and awesome God who keeps his covenant and shows mercy — do not consider all the hardship we have endured as something small. This suffering has fallen on our kings, our leaders, our priests, our prophets, our ancestors, and all your people, from the days of the Assyrian kings until today."

verses.kjv: Howbeit thou art just in all that is brought upon us; for thou hast done right, but we have done wickedly:
verses.ct: "In everything that has happened to us, you have been just. You have acted faithfully, while we have acted wickedly."

verses.kjv: Neither have our kings, our princes, our priests, nor our fathers, kept thy law, nor hearkened unto thy commandments and thy testimonies, wherewith thou didst testify against them.
verses.ct: "Our kings, leaders, priests, and ancestors did not follow your law. They did not listen to your commands or the warnings you gave them."

verses.kjv: For they have not served thee in their kingdom, and in thy great goodness that thou gavest them, and in the large and fat land which thou gavest before them, neither turned they from their wicked works.
verses.ct: "Even while they had their own kingdom, enjoying the tremendous goodness you gave them in the spacious and fertile land you set before them, they did not serve you or turn away from their evil practices."

verses.kjv: Behold, we are servants this day, and for the land that thou gavest unto our fathers to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof, behold, we are servants in it:
verses.ct: "Look at us now — we are slaves today! In the very land you gave our ancestors so they could enjoy its fruit and its good things, here we are, slaves in it!"

verses.kjv: And it yieldeth much increase unto the kings whom thou hast set over us because of our sins: also they have dominion over our bodies, and over our cattle, at their pleasure, and we are in great distress.
verses.ct: "Its abundant harvest goes to the kings you have placed over us because of our sins. They have power over our bodies and our livestock as they please, and we are in terrible distress."

verses.kjv: And because of all this we make a sure covenant, and write it; and our princes, Levites, and priests, seal unto it.
verses.ct: "Because of all this, we are making a binding agreement and putting it in writing. Our leaders, Levites, and priests are sealing it with their names."
